_header:
In Clent
cow-bach under an thorn
_description: A twelfth-century scrap, regarding the death of St. Kenelm to be sent to the pope

CamCCC26.Transcription:
In cleu under thorncat ku bechelith kenelmus kunebri heued
                    bireued
CamCCC26.Note:
Variant; added to bottom margin by contemporary (thirteenth-century)
                    hand with Latin following: In clen sub spina iacet….

CamPem82.Transcription:
In clench qu becche under ane þorneliet kenelm kinebern heued
                    bereued
CamPem82.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Kleinere mittelenglische texte.” 
             Anglia
         42 (1918): 145-224; 43 (1919): 191: 147.
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             A Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Pembroke
                College, Cambridge.
         Cambridge: at the UP, 1905: 71.
Wells,  John Edwin. 
             Manual of the Writings in Middle English, 1050-1400.
         New Haven, CT: Connecticut Academy of Arts and Sciences, 1916: 1052.

CamTCC1450.Transcription:
in clent cowbachi kennellme kyngysbyrthlyth vndyre thoryne
                    beheddyd
CamTCC1450.Note:
Followed by Latin equivalent, in clent vacce valle kennelmus / Regius
                        natus Iacet sub spina decapidatus.
CamTCC1450.Editions:
Rigg,  A. George,
                        ed.  
             Glastonbury Miscellany of the Fifteenth Century.
         Oxford, 1968: 141.
